result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael Angelo Carthran was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 2nd-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.30(2).
  • 2nd-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.30(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Restitution set at zero.
AS TO EACH COUNT:  Pay mandatory costs, assessments and surcharges.  DOC to collect monetary sums/amounts at the rate of 25% of prison funds.  Balance as condition of Extended supervision.  To be paid by end of sentence or civil judgment to be entered against the defendant and subject to other collection.

superMiscConds.notes: No violations of criminal law rising to the level of probable cause.

supervisions.notes: Court advised defendant he cannot possess firearms or body armor, he must provide a DNA sample and cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.

Court ordered a  DNA sample to be taken from defendant.
Court sentenced defendant to all costs, penalties and surcharges including DNA surcharge.  To be collected by the DOC at a rate deemed appropriate. any balance as a condition of ES.  If not paid a civil judgment to be entered.

COUNTS ONE AND THREE:  The Court vacated the previous sentence in this matter.  Defendant resentenced  on June 25, 2021.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to Milwaukee case 2015CF162.

Pursuant to wisconsin Statutes section  973.176 the Court advised the defendant of the following  restrictions:  Firearm and ammunition possession and voting.
The Court informed the defendant of requirements and penalties applicable under s. 941.29(1m) or (4m).
Consecutive to: Consecutive to count one.

superMiscConds.notes: Conditons as listed on count one.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: Concurrent with count 1 but consecutive to Milwaukee case 2015CF162.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael Angelo Carthran

Defendant Michael Angelo Carthran in court with attorney Kathleen Byrne Stilling.  Defendant Michael Angelo Carthran in custody.  Karl Peter Hayes appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: SES.
Matter in court for Hearing/ Sentencing Hearing. Upon stipulation of the parties, the Court vacated the previous sentence in this matter and proceeded to sentencing. 

  Matter scheduled for Sentencing Hearing. Statements by the State, Defense and Defendant.  


AS TO COUNT 1 : The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 4 YEARS; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 1 YEAR; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 3 YEARS; consecutive to Milwaukee case 2015CF162.

AS TO COUNT 3 : The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 4 YEARS; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 1 YEAR; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 3 YEARS; concurrent to count 1, but consecutive to Milwaukee case 2015CF162.

Court finds defendant IS eligible for the Challenge Incarceration program and the WI Substance Abuse program.  

Court ordered a DNA sample to be taken from Defendant.

Court sentenced defendant to all costs, penalties and surcharges (including DNA surcharge) to be collected by the DOC at a rate deemed appropriate, any balance as a condition of ES.  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.

Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm and ammunition possession and Voting.

The Court informed the defendant of requirements and penalties applicable under s. 941.29(1m) or (4m).

Appellate rights notice given to the defendant.

Defendant Michael Angelo Carthran in court with attorney Susan Marie Roth.  Laura Ann Crivello appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Case heard for Br. 25.  Sentencing proceeds.  State has complied with victim notification.  Statements by counsel.  

COURT ADVISES the defendant he cannot possess firearms or body armor, he must provide a DNA sample and cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.  

Count 1:  COURT ORDERS defendant to serve a term in the Wisconsin State Prison system - TOTAL LENGTH OF SENTENCE - 8 years with 37 days credit; INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT - 4 years; EXTENDED SUPERVISION - 4 years; pay mandatory costs, assessments  and surcharges by the end of the sentence or a civil judgment is to be entered against the defendant and subject to other collection.

Count 3:  COURT ORDERS defendant to serve a term in the Wisconsin State Prison system - TOTAL LENGTH OF SENTENCE - 8 years; INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT - 4 years; EXTENDED SUPERVISION - 4 years - consecutive to Count 1; pay mandatory costs, assessments and surcharges by the end of the sentence or a civil judgment is to be entered against the defendant and subject to other collection.

Court finds defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Substance Abuse Program.
Branch 25 is unable to hear this matter today. Branch 44 agreed to hear this matter on behalf of Branch 25. Parties notified. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.
Justice Point Report received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.
Cash bail from 15CF874 is to be held to be applied to any restitution and/or costs and surcharges ordered in this case and in 15CF162.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Michael Angelo Carthran in court with attorney Susan Marie Roth.  Marissa Luz Santiago appeared on behalf of Laura Crivello for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea hearing proceeds.  Pursuant to negotiations, the State moved to dismiss but read in Count 2.  Court granted State's motion and ordered Count 2 dismissed but read in.

AS TO COUNTS 1 AND 3:
Plea hearing proceeds.  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, and further advised that if not a United States citizen deportation is possible. Defendant sworn, examined as to plea, and entered a plea of guilty.  Court found defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived all constitutional rights. Plea questionnaire waiver of rights and addendum to plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulated to the criminal complaint as factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty of Counts 1 and 3 as charged in the Information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered into the record.  The Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon not to possess any firearms or body armor.    Court further advised defendant of voting ineligibility.  Parties request a separate sentencing date.  Parties were advised that as of August 1, 2015, this calendar will be transferred to Hon. Stephanie G. Rothstein, Branch 25, in Room G55 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Court ordered all terms and conditions of bail to continue and set the matter for sentencing before Branch 25 on 8/19/15 at 1:30 p.m.
This case will be heard in Branch 20 as part of consolidation with Branch 20's case 15CF874 with the permission of Branch 26.
